intro: Macaranga cuernosensis, commonly known as the horned macaranga, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its rapid growth rate and ability to form dense thickets make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
